    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card()
        Creates a random card.

      • Card

        public Card(Card orig)
        Creates a copy of another card.
        Parameters:
        orig - The card to be copied.

      • Card

        public Card(int rank,
            int suit)
        Creates a card with the rank and suit given.
        Parameters:
        rank - The card’s rank as an interger. (If an invalid value is given, the rank will be randomly chosen.)
        suit - The card’s suit as an interger. (If an invalid value is given, the suit will be randomly chosen.)

    • Method Detail

      • randRank

        private static int randRank()
        Generates a random rank.
        Returns:
        A rank as an interger.

      • randSuit

        private static int randSuit()
        Generates a random suit.
        Returns:
        A suit as an interger.

      • getRank

        public int getRank()
        Returns the rank as an interger value.
        Returns:
        The card’s rank as an interger. (e.g. 1)

      • getSuit

        public int getSuit()
        Returns the suit as an interger value.
        Returns:
        The card’s suit represented by an interger. (e.g. 0)

      • getRankShort

        public String getRankShort()
        Returns the card’s rank in shorthand.
        Returns:
        The rank in shorthand. (e.g. "A")

      • getSuitShort

        public String getSuitShort()
        Returns the suit in shorthand.
        Returns:
        The suit in shorthand. (e.g. "♠")

      • getNameShort

        public String getNameShort()
        Returns the card’s name in shorthand.
        Returns:
        The card’s name in shorthand. (e.g. "A♠")

      • compareRank

        public int compareRank(Card other)
        Compares the ranks of two cards.
        Parameters:
        other - The card to compare to.
        Returns:
        If the rank is higher than the other card’s: 1; if it is equal to other card’s: 0; if it is lower than other card’s: -1.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        The card represented as a String—the card’s name in shorthand.
